parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Jannes, a sorcerer at the court of the Pharaoh. Of Egyptian origin; Jannes, an Egyptian.
Jambres, a sorcerer at the court of the Pharaoh. Of Egyptian origin; Jambres, an Egyptian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To set against; I withstand, resist, oppose. From anti and histemi; to stand against, i.e. Oppose.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To set against; I withstand, resist, oppose. From anti and histemi; to stand against, i.e. Oppose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To destroy, corrupt. From kata and phtheiro; to spoil entirely, i.e. to destroy; or to deprave.
Probably from the base of ginosko; the intellect, i.e. Mind; by implication, meaning.
Failing to pass the test, unapproved, counterfeit. By implication, worthless.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
